title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: It is situated on the Bristolchannel, and is divided into the Upper,Lower, and Quay town. The Quay townstands close to the siiore, under a lofty hill,termed the Headland. The Upper townconsists of several irregular streets, situated on the eastern slope of the hill : mostof the houses are incommodious, and havea mean appearance.
